variant.question: In accordance with ICAO Annex 9, from which age shall Contracting States issue a separate passport to each person?

options.text: From the age of 4.
It is regardless of age.
From the age of 2.
From the age of 3.

variant.question: A passenger's baggage is mishandled by state B and inadvertently arrives to state A. What is the correct course of action?

options.text: It will be cleared if it weighs less than 12 kg.
It will NOT be transported as cargo and returned to the owner because baggage must travel with its owner.
It will be subject to the taxes of State A and must first be cleared for customs of that State before being transported as cargo.
It will be transported as cargo and the Operator shall present it in State B for customs clearance.

variant.question: When cargo, unaccompanied baggage or stores were not unloaded at their intended destination but instead were unloaded at a different international airport, the Contracting State where the unloading takes place, if satisfied that there is a valid reason for the change...

options.text: shall not impose penalties, fines and custom duties but may impose taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties and fines but may impose customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines, customs duties and taxes on the operator.
shall not impose penalties, fines and taxes but may impose custom duties on the operator.

variant.question: A person who is or will be refused admission to a State by its authorities is..

options.text: an inadmissible person.
an unruly passenger.
a person in custody.
a deportee.

variant.question: Should a State consult an operator about the period of time needed for deportation of inadmissable person?

options.text: No, the airport will inform the Operator about the time frame for removal.
No, the State determines the time frame for the removal, which is binding on the aircraft Operator.
Yes, the State should consult an operator to provide necessary amount of time.
No, the time frame for the removal is specified in ICAO Annex 9 (Facilitation).

variant.question: When shall Contracting States require exit visas from their own nationals wishing to tour abroad?

options.text: For tours abroad exceeding 90 days.
For tours abroad exceeding 60 days.
For tours abroad exceeding 30 days.
Never.

variant.question: The ICAO Contracting States establish border controls for the entry and departure of persons. â€“ Regarding the entry requirements for crew arriving on duty on an international flight,..

options.text: crew must be in uniform in order to be allowed temporary entry into the Contracting State.
crew members are subject to the same entry requirements as passengers.
States shall ensure that the Flight Crew Licence is accepted as a valid document of identity.
States shall establish measures to expedite inspection of crew members and their baggage.

variant.question: With respect to ICAO Annex 9 - Facilitation, who is responsible for producing an air waybill?

options.text: The operator or an authorised agent on the behalf of the operator.
The owner of the goods or the operator.
The owner of the good or an authorised agent on the behalf of the operator.
The operator.

variant.question: What is the ICAO definition of an "International Airport"?

options.text: An airport situated on or near the official border of a contracting state, with the appropriate security and customer handling facilities to properly facilitate international air travel.
An airport of a defined passenger handling capacity that offers facilities to carriers and operators with registered offices outside of the contracting state.
Any airport, within a contracting state that accepts international air traffic, whether equipped with formal customs facilities or not.

Any airport designated by the contracting state in whose territory it is situated as an airport of entry and departure for international air traffic, where the formalities incident to customs, immigration, public health, animal and plant quarantine and similar procedures are carried out.

variant.question: A state requiring the submission of a general declaration may use it for which of the following purposes?

options.text: To check the cargo manifest, airway bills, number of packages and their contents.
To check passengers and crew for communicative diseases.
To check passanger number and their identities.
To check the aircraft and its mandatory certificates.

variant.question: At what age does a child need to have a passport?

options.text: From Birth.
From 5 years old.
From 3 years old.
From 2 years old.
